intro: Breynia virgata, commonly known as the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. The plant features small, silver-white leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Breynia virgata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
